backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor with no implemented logic.
feature_evidence.json: Feature-evidence report listing three earthquake-refresh related features and their associated files and metadata.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: High-level summaries of all frontend files describing styling, utilities, hooks, components, and pages.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base setup defining extensive light/dark design tokens using OKLCH values and applying global styles.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point loading Leaflet scripts and styles, setting the app root, and linking favicon assets.
frontend/src/App.tsx: App wrapper applying ThemeProvider and rendering the EarthquakeDashboard.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Dashb: Dashboard summary cards showing total events, above-threshold counts, and the largest magnitude with styled UI elements.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Earth: Detailed earthquake dialog with fetched event details, magnitude badges, metadata fields, and optional moment‑tensor info.
Leaflet-based interactive map rendering earthquake markers within bounds, supporting popups, filtering, and fullscreen mode.
A virtualized table component that lists earthquake events with metadata and supports selection and constrained scrolling.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/FeedA: UI controls for filtering earthquake data by time window, magnitude, search text, and manual refresh.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Panel: A styled card wrapper providing consistent headers, subtitles, and layout for earthquake panels.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor tied to Internet Identity, invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context, including login, logout, identity loading, and status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder file noting that USGS data fetching is handled elsewhere.
frontend/src/hooks/useUsgsEarthquakes.ts: React Query hook that fetches USGS earthquake feed data based on the selected time window with periodic refresh.
frontend/src/hooks/useUsgsEventDetail.ts: Fetches and caches detailed USGS event data for a specific event URL when enabled.
frontend/src/hooks/useVirtualWindow.ts: Implements lightweight list virtualization by calculating visible item indices from scroll position and container height.
frontend/src/index.css: Global Tailwind and theme styles, including color variables, map-related overrides, and fullscreen map behavior.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeFilters.ts: Provides filtering and sorting utilities for USGS features by time window, magnitude, and place, plus a combined applyFilters pipeline.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeMapBounds.ts: Filters earthquakes to those within (or slightly outside) Leaflet map bounds with date-line wrapping handling.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeStats.ts: Computes simple stats including total count, count above a magnitude threshold, and largest-magnitude event.
frontend/src/lib/fetchJson.ts: Lightweight helper to fetch a URL and return parsed JSON with error handling.
frontend/src/lib/formatters.ts: Formatting helpers for timestamps, magnitudes, depths, and coordinates into human-readable strings.
frontend/src/lib/leafletTypes.ts: Provides Leaflet-related TypeScript interfaces plus a helper to create stylized circle markers based on magnitude.
frontend/src/lib/mmi.ts: Maps numeric MMI values to Roman numerals and labels and formats full MMI display strings.
frontend/src/lib/usgsEventDetailTypes.ts: TypeScript types for USGS event-detail API responses including moment‑tensor product metadata.
frontend/src/lib/usgsFeeds.ts: Defines USGS feed URLs by time window and helpers for magnitude labels and colors.
frontend/src/lib/usgsTypes.ts: Type definitions for USGS GeoJSON earthquake features, responses, and filter settings.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Initializes the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers and renders App.
frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.t: Implements the main earthquake dashboard with filtering, view modes, manual refresh, and detail selection.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration including theme extensions, colors, animations, and plugins.
project_state.json: Describes project state and fix requirements focused on making the Refresh Data button behave correctly.
